Color Ramp Editor

Requires: Full Development System

Click the Edit button in the Color Ramp section for each 3D graph page in the Plot Properties dialog box to display this dialog box. Use this dialog box to modify the color ramp.

This dialog box includes the following components:

  • Arrows—Highlights the selected arrow set when the arrow is black. Drag the arrow to move the color to a different point on the color ramp. You can drag all arrows except for the top and bottom.
  • Colors—Specifies the color at a point on the color ramp. Left-click the color box to change the color.
  • Color Range Control—Specifies the location of the color on the color ramp.
  • Add—Adds another arrow set to the color ramp.
  • Delete—Deletes the selected arrow set from the color ramp.
  • Interpolate—Sets that you can see the range between each color you specify on the color ramp.
  • Logarithm—Shows the color range control in the logarithm mapping mode. You also can use the Axis:Range:Range Logarithm property to display the logarithm mode programmatically.
